Player_Romus

"Indeed. But before we jump to conclusions, we must ensure we have all the facts. Blaming Pales without further concrete evidence could lead to a disastrous conflict."

Player_Romus

"Let's hear your updates on the Zille bombing. Anything new to report?"

Narrator

Lucita's expression tightens, a testament to her unspoken ambitions.

Lucita Azaro

"The evidence is irrefutable."

Lucita Azaro

"In any case, I believe that from here on out, we should refocus our efforts toward the Pales connection, even if the end results point to someone else altogether."

Player_Romus

"Maybe to you, but I'm still not sold."

Narrator

Lucita handed me a sheet of paper from her file folder for me to look over.

Hugo Toras

"Your Majesty, the situation in Iza remains fraught with challenges."

Lucita Azaro

"Unfortunately, no. The evidence on the possible culprit continues to be circumstantial at best."

Player_Romus

"It's infuriating to think that Su Omina might be falsely accused."

Hugo Toras

"The last thing we need is an escalation of violence."

Player_Romus

"Because you have biased sympathies *against* them."

Lucita Azaro

"Of course, Your Majesty."

Player_Romus

"I knew it was a mistake not to strengthen the police presence."

Lucita Azaro

"However, we can't stand by and do nothing."

Hugo Toras

"In any case, we must do something to tackle this situation."

Hugo Toras

"Agreed. Something must be done. Fast."

Lucita Azaro

"Thanks in large part for your willingness to further fund our intelligence capabilities..."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes. Quite a lot, actually..."

Player_Romus

"Pales? That's not surprising at all -- as long as your sources are accurate."

Lucita Azaro

"What can be concluded is that this is a clear act of aggression against our kingdom."

Lucita Azaro

"I understand your reservation, but we have a strong case pointing to their involvement in the matter."

Lucita Azaro

"Not suggesting, I'm *telling* you that they did. It's a clear act of aggression against our kingdom."

Lucita Azaro

"Nevertheless, just say the word, Your Majesty, and I'll immediately direct our efforts towards a more extensive investigation of Pales."

Lucita Azaro

"Which is especially concerning in the context of Pales."

Lucita Azaro

"Very well. I'll be sure to share the investigation findings with you as soon as something turns up."

Lucita Azaro

"I respect your caution, Your Majesty, but facts are facts."

Player_Romus

"I understand your concern about Wehlen, Hugo, but I believe we have no other choice but to shift focus and make Pales our number one priority."

Player_Romus

"I've heard enough. We will conduct a thorough investigation into Pales' involvement in the bombing. If the evidence points to them, we will act accordingly."

Player_Romus

"Thank you for your thorough investigation, Lucita. However, like Hugo, I believe we should focus the investigation on Wehlen. Believing that Pales had a hand in the bombing just doesn't make sense."

Player_Romus

"Unfortunately, they very well might be right."

Player_Romus

"All the more reason to clamp down on their activities."

Player_Romus

"Unfounded accusations, I'm sure."

Player_Romus

"I agree with Lucita. It's crucial to approach this situation with an open mind and consider all perspectives."

Player_Romus

"While we may not agree on everything, I must insist that we speak to one another with dignity and respect."

Player_Romus

"Will you two knock it off? This bickering is getting us nowhere."

Lucita Azaro

"Agreed. However, we shouldn't dismiss the possibility of Su Omina's involvement just because the evidence is lacking."

Player_Romus

"That's unfortunate. Not that I had high expectations for it to yield results."

Player_Romus

"Is that it or is there anything else you wish to share with the class."

Player_Romus

"So what else have you got for me? Any other developments?"

Player_Romus

"Have we exhausted all the details, or is there more you'd like to mention?"

Player_Romus

"Let's hear what you have to say on the Bludish situation."

Hugo Toras

"About time something was finally done about them."

Player_Romus

"I disagree, but don't wish to further debate the issue. Not now, at least. Please continue, Lucita."

Player_Romus

"I'm skeptical about whether it will achieve the goals Smolak hopes to accomplish with this, but time will tell."

Player_Romus

"Good. I'm glad we're being proactive on this."

Lucita Azaro

"First, by ensuring our border guards have everything they need at their disposal so they can execute their duties without hindrance."

Player_Romus

"An obvious step. Is that all?"

Lucita Azaro

"I've been collaborating with the royal navy to enhance their capabilities in patrolling our territorial waters, aimed at supporting vessels already engaged in these duties."

Lucita Azaro

"They'll be tasked with looking out for Bludish migrants trying to cross the Gulf of Mordia."

Lucita Azaro

"They were apparently trying to reach our shores. An investigation is still underway, but so far only 30 of an estimated 500 survived."

Player_Romus

"A terrible tragedy. My thoughts are with the survivors and their families."

Player_Romus

"That's unfortunate. However, they should have known better than to gamble with their lives."

Lucita Azaro

"It's been reported that an overcrowded Bludish migrant ship capsized in the Gulf just this morning after being turned away by one of our patrol vessels in the area."

Lucita Azaro

"Excuse me... *perform* their duties without hindrance. In addition to border security..."

Player_Romus

"Agreed. Traversing such a dangerous and unforgiving waterway feels like tempting fate."

Player_Romus

"When people hit rock bottom and have nothing to lose, they're more likely to take extreme measures."

Player_Romus

"Neither can I. I wouldn't risk it even if someone held a gun to my head."

Player_Romus

"Same. If I were in their shoes, I'd stand up and fight back."

Hugo Toras

"I'll never understand the rationale for what compels people to take such a risk."

Lucita Azaro

"Having covered that, I believe I've touched upon all the key aspects of this issue--"

Player_Romus

"Alone at last."

Player_Romus

"I take it the meeting wasn't adjourned after all."

Lucita Azaro

"Anyway... That's all I wanted to say. Seeing as how it's an urgent security matter, I expect to hear back from you soon."

Narrator

Her eyes lit up.

Lucita Azaro

"I'm looking forward to it. Goodnight, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"What would you like to discuss first?"

Player_Romus

"Alright. Let's begin, shall we?"

Player_Romus

"Come on, let's get this over with."

Player_Romus

"Start. We've wasted enough time as it is."

Player_Romus

"Proceed, if you will."

Narrator

I sat in my designated seat at the head of the table.

Narrator

Hugo, Lucita, and Titus rose to their feet the moment I stepped into the council chambers.

Player_Romus

"Is there a particular reason we can attribute to this increase?"

Player_Romus

"My heart goes out to them, but I'm hesitant to welcome them with open arms. Our resources are limited."

Player_Romus

"Why now? Does it relate to Wehlen's anti-Bludish campaign?"

Player_Romus

"These Bludish migrants have become a constant source of frustration."

Lucita Azaro

"While we haven't observed a significant push, we're aware that they are currently conducting covert operations to suppress Bludish communities within their borders."

Player_Romus

"It can't be a coincidence that this increase in migration coincides with my decision not to assist Wehlen in their campaign of oppression."

Lucita Azaro

"Thank you. As I was saying, although an agreement has been reached, it won't become active until Smolak initiates the necessary steps, which we believe will happen soon."

Lucita Azaro

"Of course. As I was saying, although an agreement with Smolak has been made, it remains inactive until he takes the necessary actions to set it in motion, which we believe will happen soon."

Hugo Toras

"I'm confident that it will."

Lucita Azaro

"No, there's more."

Lucita Azaro

"Gladly."

Hugo Toras

"I respectfully disagree. In my experience, people react differently to adversity -- many finding inner strength and resilience to overcome even the toughest challenges."

Hugo Toras

"And that's why you're king!"

Player_Romus

"They're migrants, not superheroes."

Lucita Azaro

"Didn't mean to damper the mood... "

Lucita Azaro

"Didn't mean to spoil the mood..."

Player_Romus

"What of their approach? Are they following the strategies we discussed?"

Player_Romus

"Excellent. Our objectives are clear -- to regain control of Zille from Wehlen's grip. We must ensure that every action we take aligns with this goal."

Player_Romus

"These types of heavy-handed operations don't sit well with me. Unfortunately, I fear they may be our only choice."

Hugo Toras

"Knowing Su Omnia like I do, I assure you they are resolute in their mission to reunite Zille with Rizia."

Lucita Azaro

"They are, indeed."

Player_Romus

"Well said. I have no doubt Zille will once again return to our fold."

Player_Romus

"Let us hope Su Omina shares that sentiment."

Player_Romus

"Stay vigilant and monitor the situation closely."

Player_Romus

"We must also consider the urgency of the situation. Waiting too long to take decisive action could allow the issue to worsen or become more complicated."

Player_Romus

"We find ourselves at a crossroads. While the evidence does suggest likely culprits, I believe ending the investigation would be more advantageous for us in the long run."

Player_Romus

"I see your point. Very well, we'll continue the investigation by looking into Wehlen's potential involvement."

Player_Romus

"We're ending the investigation, effective immediately."

Player_Romus

"Very well. if you're both determined to investigate someone, let it be Pales."

Narrator

My return journey from Morella had just concluded, and within hours of being back on Rizian soil, I was called for an internal security meeting.

Hugo Toras

"Yes, thanks for coming on such short notice."

Lucita Azaro

"Good evening, Your Majesty. I'm glad you could join us."

Player_Romus

"Fine, fine. Let's get to it."

Player_Romus

"Let's aim to finish this promptly, shall we?"

Player_Romus

"I'm hearing the Whruster Tabernacle Choir perform tonight."

Player_Romus

"I'm considering the possibility of auctioning off certain crown jewels for charity, and I'd prefer to inspect them before making my selections."

Player_Romus

"I don't wish to be here any longer than I have to."

Player_Romus

"I'm attending auditions for court jester tonight and can't be late. Either of you care to audition?"

Narrator

My remark elicited hearty laughter from Hugo, while Lucita responded with a more reserved chuckle.

Player_Romus

"But in all seriousness, I'm still exhausted from my recent visit to Morella and could use some downtime."

Lucita Azaro

"Very well. We'll do our best to expedite matters."

Lucita Azaro

"Of course. We'll make it as brief as possible."

Hugo Toras

"Well then, far be it from me to keep you from answering your call! Let's get to it then."

Hugo Toras

"Auctioning off the crown jewels? You can't be serious."

Player_Romus

"Something to do with the arts. The aim being, to project a more cultured image of myself."

Player_Romus

"We're getting off-track. Let's save this discussion for another time."

Lucita Azaro

"That's very generous of you."

Player_Romus

"Noted."

Player_Romus

"Only *your* portion."

Player_Romus

"This can be a topic for future discussion should I decide to proceed."

Player_Romus

"Well, there's always more love to give."

Hugo Toras

"How wonderful. I'm sure it will bring you great spiritual fulfillment."

Lucita Azaro

"I tend to find that sort of entertainment rather dull, but enjoy yourself nonetheless."

Hugo Toras

"Good. I do hope you keep it that way and reconsider such a proposal."

Lucita Azaro

"It's said that cultivating a cultured image can enhance one's appeal. Or so I've heard."

Hugo Toras

"Well, I do hope you don't follow through with this scheme. For the sake of the monarchy."

Narrator

Hugo, Lucita, and Titus took their respective seats. Then they opened the folders in front of them, and I did the same.

Hugo Toras

"Where's the fire? Got a more pressing appointment?"

Hugo Toras

"Forgive me. Meant no offense."

Narrator

We'd concluded the briefing in a timely manner.

Narrator

I checked my watch.

Narrator

The weight of our internal security discussions still lingered in the air as I stood alone in the room.

Narrator

Lucita gave me a knowing smirk.

Hugo Toras

"Sure, but even if they are guilty, it doesn't mean we back up Wehlen's claim."

Hugo Toras

"I have no doubt. They've been gunning Su Omina for quite some time, with the clear goal of dismantling them."

Hugo Toras

"Respectfully, Your Majesty, we should carefully assess the situation before taking any drastic measures."

Hugo Toras

"Well, in any case, I still say that we should avoid pointing fingers prematurely."

Hugo Toras

"Certainly."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, of course, Your Majesty."

Lucita Azaro

"First, by ensuring that our border guards have all the necessary resources at their disposal so that they may carry out their duties without hindrance."

Lucita Azaro

"To start with, we're ensuring that our border guards have access to all the resources they require to help them perform to the best of their abilities."

Hugo Toras

"A necessary evil."

Lucita Azaro

"We've got everything under control. You can count on that. As for their preparations..."

Hugo Toras

"Yes, but we mustn't wait too long. It's important to find a balance between long-term strategies and addressing immediate concerns."

Hugo Toras

"No doubt!"

Hugo Toras

"Aside from not giving them the satisfaction of right, it risks escalating tensions between our nations even further."

Lucita Azaro

"I concur. Nevertheless, we shouldn't rule out the potential involvement of Su Omina simply because there's a lack of evidence."

Hugo Toras

"Given the lack of concrete evidence, the last thing we want is a witch hunt on our hands."

Lucita Azaro

"While that may be, I'm still fully capable of taking an objective approach when evaluating a situation."

Hugo Toras

"Without question."

Lucita Azaro

"While we haven't observed a significant push, we're aware that they are currently conducting covert operations to suppress Bludish communities within their borders."

Lucita Azaro

"Well, in all likelihood, they wouldn't even be an issue if it wasn't for Whelen conducting covert operations to suppress Bludish communities within their borders."

Lucita Azaro

"While we haven't observed a significant push, we're aware that they are currently conducting covert operations to suppress Bludish communities within their borders."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, we believe so."

Lucita Azaro

"From what we can tell, Wehlen is responsible for the situation in the first place."

Hugo Toras

"Exactly."

Player_Romus

"These types of heavy-handed operations don't sit well with me. But they very well may produce the best results."

Lucita Azaro

"But as I was saying..."

Hugo Toras

"It's a necessary evil."

Player_Romus

"Actually, I think that's enough briefing for tonight. Let's adjourn."

Titus Gordion

"Upon a careful examination, I've discovered that there is indeed evidence linking Su Omina to the bombing."

Titus Gordion

"I'm afraid so. However, their involvement is quite different from what I believe any of us were expecting."

Titus Gordion

"It turns out, we were able to trace one of Su Omina's members to a fertilizer plant, TerraGrowth Agrochem, just outside of Iza. He's been working there for years."

Titus Gordion

"And it just so happens that the residue found at the bombing site matches the materials produced at this very plant."

Player_Romus

"So there *is* a direct link to Su Omina."

Player_Romus

"My cousin Rico wouldn't happen to have financial ties or some other connection linking him to the plant, would he?"

Titus Gordion

"But that's not what's most intriguing about this whole situation--"

Player_Romus

"Well go on. Don't leave me waiting. Spit it out."

Player_Romus

"No. That can't be true. As a former member, I can attest first-hand that they're a purely peaceful organization."

Titus Gordion

"However, that's not what most intriguing about this situation--"

Titus Gordion

"Despite being located in Rizia, the fertilizer plant is, in fact, state-owned by Pales."

Player_Romus

"Pales! I knew it! I had a feeling they were behind it all along."

Player_Romus

"Pales? Are you sure? While we may have our disagreements, they wouldn't go so far as to resort to violence."

Titus Gordion

"In short, we've identified a Su Omina member with ties to employment at a fertilizer plant, TerraGrowth Agrochem, located outside of Iza."

Titus Gordion

"I know it may be difficult to believe, but the facts speak for themselves. But that's not what's most curious about this situation--"

Titus Gordion

"I know this news might be difficult to hear, but setting aside one's personal feelings could provide a new viewpoint on the matter."

Titus Gordion

"But anyway, the Su Omina factory worker isn't what I find most intriguing about this situation--"

Titus Gordion

"Not that I've come across. But it doesn't mean he isn't affiliated with them in some way shape or form."

Titus Gordion

"There's another piece of the puzzle you may find just as intriguing, if not more so--"

Titus Gordion

"That may very well be true. But I believe it's still worth looking into."

Titus Gordion

"Then I'm pleased to hear I confirmed your suspicion."

Titus Gordion

"A certain possibility, but I felt it needed mentioning."

Narrator

Titus greeted me with a simple nod. His presence must mean he had information on the Zille bombing.

Player_Romus

"I'm just throwing around the idea of auctioning some crown jewels for charity, and I thought I'd check them out first."

Player_Romus

"I'm heading to the vault after this to inspect the crown jewels and determine which ones would be ideal for auction."

Player_Romus

"I can't resist the allure of the Cantuavo red waiting for me back in my chambers."

Player_Romus

"After the taxing ITZ negotiations, I'd like to unwind with a glass of Romus the Red."

Hugo Toras

"A well-deserved indulgence, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"Yes. A well-deserved indulgence, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"The perfect companion to unwind after a day like today. But yes, let's proceed. Far be it for me to keep you from such an indulgence."

Hugo Toras

"Well then, far be it from me to prevent you from responding to that call! Let's get to it then."

Player_Romus

"I don't want to be late to the Whruster Tabernacle Choir performance this evening."

Player_Romus

"I've got a performance by the Whruster Tabernacle Choir on my schedule this evening and I don't want to be here any longer than I have to."

Player_Romus

"This isn't how I wanted to spend the rest of my evening."

Player_Romus

"I've got plans this evening that don't involve meetings."

Hugo Toras

"Let me guess... You've got a hot date."

Player_Romus

"Auditions for the court jester are tonight, and I wouldn't want to miss the fun. You should come -- better yet, audition yourselves."

Player_Romus

"I'm overseeing auditions for the court jester late. Whose brave enough to try out?"

Hugo Toras

"We'll be as expedient as possible, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"We'll be sure you'll make it on time."

Titus Gordion

"I attended one of their performances just last year. You won't be disappointed."

Titus Gordion

"Nor should you. Having attended one of their performances last year, I guarantee you won't be disappointed."

Narrator

Lucita and I exchanged and brief glance before looking away.

Narrator

Everyone directed their glances toward Titus.

Titus Gordion

"No. Just no."

Titus Gordion

"Agreed."

Hugo Toras

"Su Omina? You can't be serious."

Hugo Toras

"I'm sorry, but with all due respect, Captain Gordion, you must be mistaken. Su Omina would never resort to such drastic actions."

Lucita Azaro

"We're talking about capacitors and resistors, in particular. They're crucial for creating precise and dependable triggering mechanisms."

Player_Romus

"It's possible that they want to assert themselves as a dominant power in the region. This bombing could be part of a larger strategy to establish themselves as a key player."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, but just because it's risky doesn't mean they aren't stupid enough to try it."

Hugo Toras

"While that's a possibility, it's also important to consider the potential consequences of such a strategy."

Lucita Azaro

"It's a risky approach, but they might have seen it as a means to a potentially stronger diplomatic position, which they very well might have succeeded in achieving, considering our deal."

Hugo Toras

"But why would Pales do it? What would they have to gain?"

Titus Gordion

"I agree with Lucita. A possible relation between the two issues deserves further scrutiny."

Hugo Toras

"Yes, they are among the supporters in question."

Hugo Toras

"I still think it's a mistake to take our eyes off of Wehlen, but if this is the avenue you wish to pursue, I won't speak of it any further."

Lucita Azaro

"If that is your wish, Your Majesty, but I strongly encourage you to reconsider."

Lucita Azaro

"I'll get to working on this promptly and let you know when developments arise."

Hugo Toras

"Diverting attention off themselves is more like it."

Narrator

I knew my council's arguments were sound, and the underlying question was whether or not continuing the investigation -- be it Pales or Wehlen -- worth the potential consequences.

Narrator

The tension in the atmosphere was clear, but nobody voiced their opposition.

Narrator

Lucita let out a small sign of exasperation.

Player_Romus

"Yes, yes... I see your point. Just give me a moment to think."

Lucita Azaro

"Why am I not surprised."

Titus Gordion

"It would appear that way, yes."

Player_Romus

"Please give the good captain the respect he deserves and refrain from interruptions."

Player_Romus

"Now, Uncle, let him speak. I want to hear what he has uncovered."

Player_Romus

"So sure of yourself, are you Uncle?"

Player_Romus

"Agreed. I find what you're saying, Titus, hard to believe."

Hugo Toras

"I can assure you he doesn't. And to be perfectly candid, I'm offended that such an accusation would even be broached."

Player_Romus

"As king, I'm allowed to broach any subject matter I see fit. If that's going to be a problem, you're welcome to dismiss yourself from this meeting."

Player_Romus

"Relax, Uncle. I didn't mean to imply that Rico had anything to do with it."

Hugo Toras

"Here's a fact... Rico had nothing to with the bombing. Period."

Hugo Toras

"No, Your Grace. That won't be necessary. I meant no offense. All I'm saying is that Rico had nothing to do with the Zille bombing."

Player_Romus

"We'll see about that."

Player_Romus

"For his sake, I'm hope you're right."

Narrator

A tinge of red began to color Hugo's face, yet he remained silent.

Lucita Azaro

"How about we let Captain Gordion finish what he had to say before we jump to conclusions."

Lucita Azaro

"Well, what we *can* be certain about is that this may warrant further scrutiny into their activities in the region."

Titus Gordion

"I'll promptly deliver the results of the investigation to you as soon as they're available."

Player_Romus

"I understand your resistance to investigating Su Omina, Uncle. As someone who was once a vocal supporter, I'm deeply troubled by this turn of events. But I believe we have no other choice but to shift focus and make them our number one priority."

Player_Romus

"We will conduct a thorough investigation into Pales' involvement in the bombing. If the evidence points to them, we will act accordingly."

Player_Romus

"While the evidence does suggest likely culprits, I believe ending the investigation would be more advantageous for us in the long run."

Player_Romus

"We're ending the investigation, effective immediately."

Player_Romus

"Very well. if you're both determined to investigate someone, let it be Pales."

Hugo Toras

"Great! I have no doubt any lingering suspicions you may have against Su Omina will be will be thoroughly addressed and resolved."

Hugo Toras

"Diverting attention off themselves is more like it."

Player_Romus

"Yes, yes... I see your point. Just give me a moment to think."

Player_Romus

"I understand your perspective. Please allow me a moment to reflect on this."

Player_Romus

"Will everyone shut up for five seconds? I can barely hear myself think."

Narrator

But with cries of justice being screamed from all around, could I afford not to?

Narrator

The tension in the atmosphere was clear, but nobody voiced their opposition.

Titus Gordion

"Anyway, that's all the pertinent information I've been able to gather."

Lucita Azaro

"I agree with the captain. If Pales is involved, this would escalate our relationship to a whole new and dangerous level."

Lucita Azaro

"It certainly is troubling if it turns out Pales was involved."

Lucita Azaro

"You were right to bring this forward, Captain. While coincidences can happen, we shouldn't dismiss the possibility of a deeper connection too quickly."

Player_Romus

"Alright. Let's forget about linking Su Omina to the bombing for the moment, and go back to Pales' possible involvement. What else do we know?"

Titus Gordion

"Yes, it does seem to underscore hostile intentions."

Lucita Azaro

"Well, their provocative behavior in the past, especially over their claim to the gas fields, certainly doesn't do them any favors."

Player_Romus

"Agreed. Their villainization is starting to get out of hand. Let's turn our focus back to Pales. What else aren't we considering?"

Lucita Azaro

"Well, for starters, we can't ignore Pales provocative behavior during past dealings -- the gas dispute, to name one."

Player_Romus

"Let's not let paranoia cloud our judgment, shall we? In any case, let's get back to discussing Pales possible involvement."

Titus Gordion

"Agreed. Factoring that in changes the dynamics of the situation considerably."

Player_Romus

"Oh, my God... stop talking."

Lucita Azaro

"It's clear to me that we should press on with the investigation, refining our focus on based on the details Captain Gordion has presented."

Hugo Toras

"Well, if it's between Pales and Su Omina, I think it goes without saying who I would choose to investigate further -- or better yet, *not* choose."

Player_Romus

"Thank you, Captain. You've given me a lot to think about."

Player_Romus

"Thanks for the update Captain, however, I'm disappointed that's all you were able to uncover."

Player_Romus

"Well, it goes without saying that this news is deeply troubling."

Titus Gordion

"I'm here to assist in any way I can."

Lucita Azaro

"I think both options have their merits, but I'm inclined to investigate Pales."

Hugo Toras

"Well, Your Majesty, suggesting that Su Omina is involvement in this matter, would pose serious domestic challenges."

Player_Romus

"I have reservations about delving deeper into an investigation into Pales. I fear it would have negative consequences for us, especially if it were to become public."

Player_Romus

"Yes. Refocusing our efforts toward the Pales connection might very well be our best course of action."

Hugo Toras

"Internationally, this move could strain our relations with not only Pales but the region as a whole. Our focus should be on Wehlen's de-occupation of Zille, who I suspect is really behind the bombing."

Hugo Toras

"And if we're talking domestically, it's a double-edged sword. While we might rally support, we may also face pushback from those who are convinced Wehlen was behind it."

Hugo Toras

"And that's not even factoring in how this would be seen domestically, where ardent supporters of Zille liberation would rally against such a move."

Hugo Toras

"Sorry, but I'm not convinced. Such a shift in priorities could not only damage our relationship with Pales but also create tension throughout the region when our main focus should be on ending the occupation of Zille."

Lucita Azaro

"We can 'what if' worse-case scenarios all we like, but inaction can create a host of issues, particularly if we can't identify the actual culprit, or worse if the wrong party is held responsible."

Player_Romus

"What kind of repercussions could be anticipated if we direct our investigation toward Pales?"

Hugo Toras

"My son, the Duke of Iza, being one of them."

Hugo Toras

"It would also put a strain on our budget as well."

Player_Romus

"I can't say I'm not relieved. I was beginning to grow tired of this mess altogether."

Player_Romus

"Well, if I'd known that from the beginning, I'd have ended this conversation much sooner."

Player_Romus

"That's unfortunate. But if the treasury won't allow for it, then my hands are tied."

Player_Romus

"If we pursue this course of action and it leads to identifying those responsible for the bombing, whether it's Su Omina, Pales, or any other party, there are significant political risks involved that clearly outweigh the potential advantages."

Lucita Azaro

"That's all said and good, but maybe it's time that the investigation falls under my jurisdiction."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, Your Majesty."

Hugo Toras

"I'm sorry, but I believe pursuing this path would be akin to chasing a red herring, and it won't lead us anywhere productive."

Narrator

Hugo's brows furrowed as he clenched his fists in a clear display of frustration and disappointment.

Hugo Toras
